ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 7 hours
4 hours
10 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Strength: The course provides useful quantitative skills.Weakness: The course is too conceptual. I hope to learn more application topics and SAS skills.
Probably it can focus more on the theoretical part.
This course is helpful in real data analysis, it also help you learn SAS.

The course didn't seem to have a well-defined audience. Sometimes the material seemed to be more geared to students without much background in statistics, but at other times, the material seemed to be geared toward students with a stronger background. This made the course a little difficult to follow at times, and it became hard to understand the expectations of the instructor.
Poorly made slides, unclear delivery of knowledge.LAB sessions were even more helpful than the lectures.If it's not required course, I'd have dropped it.

Although the material was interesting, the lectures didn't go into much theoretical detail.The HW's mostly involved coding in SAS. It was helpful to learn some SAS but the HW's didn't reinforce the material learned in class as well.
Way too much material way too fast. Narrow the scope.
good
Lectures are well explained. labs needs to be better structured, and lab materials needs to be improved so that it is more focused on interpretation of results not just analytics.
Too theoratical. Please be more practical in lecture.
can't understand the course.lecture note given by the instructor sucks.not intuitive at all.
weakness: graded students in two groups(biostat&nonbiostat) did not make sense, not very fair
it would be better if the course can be more systematic, and well-explained.
Course Materials (PPT slides etc) and lectures are really poor for understanding. Lab by TA could help to understand the course.

worst course I have ever takeninstructor unprepared to teach; slides with mistakes; materials taught not fully reinforced in homework; concepts unclear; extremely disorganized and unfair for students in biostatistics (biostat students had one extra question on the exam!!)NO SOLUTIONS for any of the homework or exam questions! This was the worst part of the class.
Strength: it is helpful to know about longitudinal and multi-level data analysisWeakness: sometimes it is hard to follow the instructor, and the exam doesn't relate to the materials a lot

This is important material for public health students. Learning data analysis techniques for longitudinal and multilevel data will be very useful.Pros:Important subjectCons:Material is not well organized or taught.The slides are repetitive, have typos, and are often have text extending off the edge of the page (which can't be read).

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Haiqun Lin  Haiqun is very responsible, but I fell it is not so fair for biostats students, as biostats students are required to do more problems in the same time in the midterm exam, and are graded separately with non-biostats students. I understand that biostats students are expected to grasp some in-depth topics, but most of us are unable to finish all questions in the given time in the midterm exam.
Instructor: Haiqun Lin  I think the quality of lecture notes need improvement. The notations are messy. Reading lecture notes after class can only make you more confused.
Instructor: Haiqun Lin  The lectures are not detailed enough in theory.
Instructor: Haiqun Lin  She spoke too fast but was enthusiastic.
Instructor: Haiqun Lin  good
Instructor: Haiqun Lin  The lecturer explains difficult statistical concepts very well in a good pace. Perhaps a little more materials on multilevel analysis would be better.
Instructor: Haiqun Lin  focus more on teachingmake the lecture notes neat
Instructor: Haiqun Lin  helpful after class, but give too much hw in the final week
Instructor: Haiqun Lin  Very nice person, but still need to improve teaching skills a little bit.
Instructor: Haiqun Lin  She may be very good as a researcher but not good at teaching. Course Materials (PPT slides etc) and lectures are really poor for understanding.

Instructor: Haiqun Lin  This instructor cannot teach and should not teach anymore if YSPH wants its program to maintain its prestigious title as one of best public health schools.This instructor skips over important concepts and dwells on things that have no relevance to homework or practical use. Slide materials are from years ago, and contain mistakes, and no detailed derivations. No proof of how an equation or concept came to be, and no explanation of usage. Absolutely ridiculous homework that have little relevance to class and are so time consuming.When she teaches, she always separates the biostat students, which seems quite prejudice sometimes. She always says "you know" ... as if asking us do you understand, but when we say we don't, she replies "you should" or "do the derivation at home". Even worse, if she does explain, its unclear and conceptually irrelevant. This is either because she knows the material so well and so advanced that she is incapable of explaining or she is not capable of teaching this material due to lack of knowledge.She is never available for help and ALWAYS unresponsive to emails.Yale should be ashamed to have such an irresponsible professor to teach students who pay thousands of dollars to be here.
Instructor: Haiqun Lin  she can be confusing sometimes, it is hard to follow her during the lecture. The lecture note can be messy sometimes.

Instructor: Haiqun Lin  Dr. Lin certainly seemed to care about her students.Her examples were often not clear to me (not a biostats student). She seemed to expect a higher level of knowledge than was usually present in the class.The class seemed poorly organized:There was not a scheduled date for the midterm on the syllabus, and we were given the midterm with just 1 week's notice.There was only 1 day to do HW2 after that week's lab.This is maybe a complaint about my fellow students rather than Dr. Lin, but there was often a lot of talking going on between students which made it hard to focus on what was being taught. Dr. Lin never asked the students to be quiet or leave.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Lu Wang  TAs are always available for questions. However, more structured office hours would be better.
Instructor: Lu Wang  nice job Lu and Yizhen
Instructor: Lu Wang  Great
Instructor: Lu Wang  Lab by TA could help to understand the course.
Instructor: Yizhen Xu  Yizhen Xu is a very responsible and excellent TA.She is always able to solve my questions very patiently.
Instructor: Yizhen Xu  Yizhen gives organized and helpful TA sessions, as well as timely response to homework questions.
Instructor: Yizhen Xu  She did a good job.
Instructor: Yizhen Xu  Yizhen did a really nice job during the semester, I am thankful of her time and lab lectures.
Instructor: Yizhen Xu  She is very helpful. I don't think I learned a lot from lecture. But I did learn most of knowledge and skills of this course from her.

Instructor: Yizhen Xu  Yizhen was an excellent TA for the course. Her lab sessions were extremely helpful in learning not only the SAS code, but also helping to learn the material covered in the course lecture. She proved immensely helpful with homework questions, as well as clarification questions regarding some of the more difficult material.
Instructor: Yizhen Xu  Learned a lot from lab session.

Instructor: Yizhen Xu  Yizhen was a very resourceful and helpful teaching fellow.She went through explanations of a lot of the theoretical concepts during her office hours and the lab sessions.She was very responsive to questions asked either in person or via email.
Instructor: Yizhen Xu  She was great.
Instructor: Yizhen Xu  good
Instructor: Yizhen Xu  great. thanks.
Instructor: Yizhen Xu  not very reachable after class

Instructor: Yizhen Xu  If Yizhen wasn't the TA, this course would have turned out way worse. Many thanks to this TA for compiling the lab notes and SAS code that got us through basic concepts and homework. Many thanks!Perhaps it was because the professor did not provide solutions to the homework, but places I knew I was wrong or I asked for further explanation were not marked wrong by the grader, Wang Lu, which was annoying.
Instructor: Yizhen Xu  In lab sessions, she explains things clearly.

Instructor: Yizhen Xu  Yizhen did a pretty good job as TA. She would work with sutdents and try to answer our questions, of which there were many. She stayed after lab at least twice to try to answer questions for homeworks which were due the next day.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I will recommend it to other students because it provides necessary quantitative skills.
Yes.
The material is useful and helpful however, you might have to spend time outside class and use resources other than the lectures and the textbook.
I would not recommend it in its current state. It should be more practical for general public health students.
good

I would recommend this course to students interested in both the theoretical aspects and applications of longitudinal and multilevel analysis. However, students who take it should be aware that the course requires greater time to fully understand the concepts andbe able to apply them.
The course is compulsory. But I don't want to recommend.
a lot of work, less organized
I would NEVER recommend this course to anyone. EVER.two words: worst course
yes, but be prepared to spend a lot of time on it

In this course you learn longitudinal and multilevel data analysis techniques. The material is challenging, but I feel like I now have at least a cursory understanding of it. I would only recommend it to people who feel that they have a solid foundation in statistics, otherwise it will be overwhelming.
